Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Legal_Provision_Involved: Section 18.1(4) of the Federal Court Act
Outcome: Motion to introduce fresh evidence dismissed
Grounds_for_Claim: Claim for Convention Refugee status based on religious persecution (Jehovah's Witnesses)
Remedy_Requested: Introduction of fresh evidence (the Article) in judicial review
Legal_Framework: Canadian refugee determination system, Federal Court Act
Evidence_Requirement: Fresh evidence must be unavailable previously and relevant
Institutional_Action: Refusal of refugee claim by the Immigration and Refugee Board
Government_Body_or_Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court of Canada
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (Article on alternative service statistics)
Temporal_Context: Six weeks before Board’s decision – when evidence became available
Geographic_Context: Canada; reference to conditions abroad affecting Jehovah's Witnesses
Assessment_Standard: Availability and relevance of fresh evidence
Complaint_Issues: Procedural fairness, admissibility of new evidence
Legal_Standard: Test for admitting fresh evidence on judicial review
Protection_Claim: Need for protection as a Convention refugee due to fear of persecution
State_Protection_Assessment: Assessment of whether state protection is adequate for Jehovah's Witnesses
Risk_Factor: Persecution due to religious refusal of military service
Credibility: Not directly challenged; issue focused on procedural admissibility
State_Protection_Adequacy: Implied inadequacy due to risk of punishment for conscientious objection
Risk_Nature: Legal prosecution or punishment for refusing compulsory military service on religious grounds
Perpetrator_Entity: State authorities in country of origin enforcing conscription
Legal_Basis: Geneva Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees
Victim_Basis: Religious belief and associated risk of persecution
